datamodel

Class CustomerList

  • java.lang.Object
    • datamodel.CustomerList
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, IObserver, ISubject

    public class CustomerList
extends java.lang.Object
implements IObserver, ISubject, java.io.Serializable
    This class represents all the customers that have registered with the Fast Courier Service company. Each registered customer object maintains a list of every delivery the Fast Courier Service company has undertaken on their behalf.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CustomerList()
      Default constructor builds an empty customer list object with no customers yet registered to use the delivery services.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CustomerList

        public CustomerList()
        Default constructor builds an empty customer list object with no customers yet registered to use the delivery services. Required for serialisation.

    • Method Detail

      • addCustomer

        public void addCustomer(Customer newCustomer)
        This method adds a new customer to the list of customers that have registered to use the Fast Courier Service.
        Parameters:
        newCustomer -

      • removeCustomerAt

        public Customer removeCustomerAt(int index)
                          throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        Customers are stored in a zero based array, this method removes the customer at the given index
        Parameters:
        index - - The zero based index of the customer to remove from the customer list
        Returns:
        - The Customer object removed from the list or NULL if no customer was removed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - - If index is negative or greater than or equal to the size of the customer list.

      • getAllNames

        public java.lang.String[] getAllNames()
        This method retrieves an array of customer names (full names) providing a complete list of all registered customers.
        Returns:
        - An array of String objects where each element contains a registered customers full name

      • getCustomerAt

        public Customer getCustomerAt(int index)
        This method retrieves the customer object at the specified zero based index in the CustomerList
        Parameters:
        index - - The zero based index of the customer to retrieve from the customer list
        Returns:
        - A Customer object at the specified index position.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        This method retrieves the total number of customers that are registered to use the Fast Courier Service.
        Returns:
        - An int being the total number of registered customers.

      • registerObserver

        public java.lang.Boolean registerObserver(IObserver o)
        Description copied from interface: ISubject
        This method registers a new observer with the subject. After this method completes successfully the newly registered object will receive notifications to update when the state of this subject object is changed.
        Specified by:
        registerObserver in interface ISubject
        Parameters:
        o - - The object that needs to receive notification of changes to this subjects state
        Returns:
        - Boolean True if the provided object has been added to the list of observers and will receive notification when this subject changes state, False otherwise.

      • removeObserver

        public java.lang.Boolean removeObserver(IObserver o)
        Description copied from interface: ISubject
        This method removes an object from the list of objects receiving notification of state changes to this subject object.
        Specified by:
        removeObserver in interface ISubject
        Parameters:
        o - - The object that no longer needs to receive notification of changes to this subjects state.
        Returns:
        - Boolean True if this object will not receive notification of changes to this subjects state, False otherwise.
